ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This was an excellent course! I appreciated having the opportunity to work directly with a client organization on real life issues.
This class will be great if you're excited about the specific clinic project you're working on.
The clinical projects (if you got one of your top choices)
Working directly with client organizations.
It depends entirely on the project. i enjoyed my project, so that was the best part. The field trip was also excellent.
Working directly with a client on a law project.
Professor Kennedy's patience and support facilitates a very rewarding work-like experience with diverse and interesting clinic clients.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The weeks with in-class exercises make it difficult to complete the clinical project hour requirements. (e.g. prepping for oral argument)
Everything was fine.
Again, so much depends on the project. I wouldn't really change anything.

The time in the clinic seminar or group-meetings with instructor sometimes seemed unnecessary. Also, the class seems entirely geared to Yale Law students and feels like FES students are just there to fill out the size of the group projects.
N/A

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: The instructor was available, as was the TA.
Simi was very available and helpful.
Feedback on the memo from Kit was excellent. Generally, the instructor/TA were responsive when asked, but generally disengaged from our clinic project so were a bit unnecessary for our success.
Excellent.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I am interested in environmental law/policy. I had the opportunity to work on a case that was international in nature and strengthen my understanding of foreign legal systems.
This is an excellent course for any student interested in law and policy.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I heard that it would be hands-on. I wanted experience working with an organization on a project.
Because I liked my project and the idea of working on a real memo for a real organization. Good practice for post-school life and less academic, overall.
Wanted to work on a project for a client that might be used for a real legal strategy.
I enjoyed this opportunity to expand my law/policy work experience.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Not completely. I liked my project but didn't find the class exercises to be particularly helpful.
Yes!
Yes.
It was ok. I wasn't that excited about my project, but it was fairly interesting.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes!
Yes. I learned a lot about my topic, about working with a group, and about the organization for which I worked.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Disadvantages: Different working styles (collaborative v. solitary), not connecting with group members.Advantages: Being able to bounce ideas off each other, different strengths brought to the group (research, technical, bluebooking, etc)

My teammates have extensive experience and knowledge in law. I learned a ton working with them. I am accustomed to approaching environmental issues from a scientific standpoint. Working in the clinic, I learned about the legal tools available to address environmental problems.
Group work is always difficult. The advantage is that we achieved wider scope than we would have gotten on our own. But, consolidation of work productwas difficult as always with group work.
Was able to learn things from group members, and we could help each other. Overall, the group functioned very efficiently.
Working as a group allowed us to address larger issues than would have been possible.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Think long and hard about what project you ask for since it will require so much time and effort throughout the entire semester. Aside from being something you are interested in, do you think you have something to offer the project?
Definitely take the course! This course is unlike most other FES courses since it allows you the opportunity to work hands-on with a client organization.
Try and get a clear idea of your project goals and client expectations as early in the semester as possible.
Make sure you really like the project you're working on, or that you want to make connections with that particular client for the future.
It's great! Take it!
